Dataframe outputs

Indrajeet Patil

2021-05-10

Source: vignettes/web_only/dataframe_outputs.Rmd
dataframe_outputs.Rmd

Introduction

The statsExpressions package has two key aims: to provide a consistent syntax to do statistical analysis with tidy data, and to provide statistical expressions (i.e., a pre-formatted in-text statistical result) for plotting functions. Currently, it supports common types of statistical approaches and tests: parametric, nonparametric, robust, and Bayesian t-test, one-way ANOVA, correlation analyses, contingency table analyses, and meta-analyses. The functions are pipe-friendly and compatible with tidy data.

Statistical packages exhibit substantial diversity in terms of their syntax and expected input type. This can make it difficult to switch from one statistical approach to another. For example, some functions expect vectors as inputs, while others expect dataframes. Depending on whether it is a repeated measures design or not, different functions might expect data to be in wide or long format. Some functions can internally omit missing values, while other functions error in their presence. Furthermore, if someone wishes to utilize the objects returned by these packages downstream in their workflow, this is not straightforward either because even functions from the same package can return a list, a matrix, an array, a dataframe, etc., depending on the function.

This is where statsExpressions comes in: It can be thought of as a unified portal through which most of the functionality in these underlying packages can be accessed, with a simpler interface and no requirement to change data format.

Dataframes

The dataframe will contain the following columns (the exact columns will depend on the test and the statistical approach):

  • statistic: the numeric value of a statistic.

  • df: the numeric value of a parameter being modeled (often degrees of freedom for the test); note that if no.parameters = 0L (e.g., for non-parametric tests), this column will be irrelevant.

  • df.error and df: relevant only if the statistic in question has two degrees of freedom (e.g., anova).

  • p.value: the two-sided p-value associated with the observed statistic.

  • method: the details of the statistical test carried out.

  • estimate: estimated value of the effect size.

  • conf.low: lower bound for the effect size estimate.

  • conf.high: upper bound for the effect size estimate.

  • conf.level: width of the confidence interval.

  • effectsize: the type of the effect size.

For details about the tests and types of effect size estimates they correspond to, see: https://indrajeetpatil.github.io/statsExpressions/articles/stats_details.html

One-sample tests

# setup
library(statsExpressions)

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
one_sample_test(
  data = ggplot2::msleep,
  x = brainwt,
  test.value = 0.275,
  type = "parametric",
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 11
#>      mu statistic df.error p.value method            estimate conf.level
#>   <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>                <dbl>      <dbl>
#> 1 0.275    0.0504       55   0.960 One Sample t-test  0.00665       0.95
#>   conf.low conf.high effectsize expression
#>      <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>      <list>    
#> 1   -0.254     0.267 Hedges' g  <language>

# ----------------------- non-parametric -----------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
one_sample_test(
  data = ggplot2::msleep,
  x = brainwt,
  test.value = 0.275,
  type = "nonparametric",
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 9
#>   statistic    p.value method                    estimate conf.level conf.low
#>       <dbl>      <dbl> <chr>                        <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1      5.51 0.00000738 Wilcoxon signed rank test   -0.689       0.95   -0.922
#>   conf.high effectsize        expression
#>       <dbl> <chr>             <list>    
#> 1    -0.400 r (rank biserial) <language>

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
one_sample_test(
  data = ggplot2::msleep,
  x = brainwt,
  test.value = 0.275,
  type = "robust",
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 9
#>   statistic p.value method                                 estimate conf.low
#>       <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>                                     <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1     -14.7       0 Bootstrap-t method for one-sample test   0.0390  0.00201
#>   conf.high conf.level effectsize   expression
#>       <dbl>      <dbl> <chr>        <list>    
#> 1    0.0759       0.95 Trimmed mean <language>

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
one_sample_test(
  data = ggplot2::msleep,
  x = brainwt,
  test.value = 0.275,
  type = "bayes",
  bf.prior = 0.8,
)
#> # A tibble: 2 x 13
#>   term       estimate conf.level conf.low conf.high    pd rope.percentage
#>   <chr>         <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>
#> 1 Difference  0.00952       0.95  -0.250      0.255 0.532          0.619 
#> 2 Cohens_d    0.276         0.95   0.0153     0.536 0.978          0.0525
#>   prior.distribution prior.location prior.scale  bf10 method          expression
#>   <chr>                       <dbl>       <dbl> <dbl> <chr>           <list>    
#> 1 cauchy                          0         0.8 0.130 Bayesian t-test <language>
#> 2 cauchy                          0         0.8 0.130 Bayesian t-test <language>

Two-sample tests

within-subjects design

# setup
library(statsExpressions)

# data
df <- dplyr::filter(bugs_long, condition %in% c("LDLF", "LDHF"))

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
two_sample_test(
  data = df,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  type = "p",
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 12
#>   term   group     statistic df.error       p.value method        estimate
#>   <chr>  <chr>         <dbl>    <dbl>         <dbl> <chr>            <dbl>
#> 1 desire condition      6.65       90 0.00000000222 Paired t-test    0.691
#>   conf.level conf.low conf.high effectsize expression
#>        <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>      <list>    
#> 1       0.95    0.465     0.922 Hedges' g  <language>

# ----------------------- non-parametric -----------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
two_sample_test(
  data = df,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  type = "np"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 11
#>   parameter1 parameter2 statistic      p.value method                   
#>   <chr>      <chr>          <dbl>        <dbl> <chr>                    
#> 1 desire     condition       7.72 0.0000000241 Wilcoxon signed rank test
#>   estimate conf.level conf.low conf.high effectsize        expression
#>      <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>             <list>    
#> 1    0.761       0.95    0.600     0.874 r (rank biserial) <language>

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
two_sample_test(
  data = df,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  type = "r"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 10
#>   statistic df.error      p.value
#>       <dbl>    <dbl>        <dbl>
#> 1      6.46       54 0.0000000313
#>   method                                             estimate conf.low conf.high
#>   <chr>                                                 <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1 Yuen's test on trimmed means for dependent samples    0.533    0.369     0.707
#>   conf.level effectsize                                              expression
#>        <dbl> <chr>                                                   <list>    
#> 1       0.95 Algina-Keselman-Penfield robust standardized difference <language>

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
two_sample_test(
  data = df,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  type = "bayes"
)
#> # A tibble: 2 x 13
#>   term       estimate conf.level conf.low conf.high    pd rope.percentage
#>   <chr>         <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>
#> 1 Difference   -1.62        0.95   -2.12     -1.14      1               0
#> 2 Cohens_d      0.680       0.95    0.449     0.901     1               0
#>   prior.distribution prior.location prior.scale     bf10 method         
#>   <chr>                       <dbl>       <dbl>    <dbl> <chr>          
#> 1 cauchy                          0       0.707 4762370. Bayesian t-test
#> 2 cauchy                          0       0.707 4762370. Bayesian t-test
#>   expression
#>   <list>    
#> 1 <language>
#> 2 <language>

between-subjects design

# setup
set.seed(123)
library(statsExpressions)

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
# unequal variance
two_sample_test(
  data = ToothGrowth,
  x = supp,
  y = len,
  type = "p"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 14
#>   term  group mean.group1 mean.group2 statistic df.error p.value
#>   <chr> <chr>       <dbl>       <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl>
#> 1 len   supp         20.7        17.0      1.92     55.3  0.0606
#>   method                  estimate conf.level conf.low conf.high effectsize
#>   <chr>                      <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>     
#> 1 Welch Two Sample t-test    0.488       0.95  -0.0217     0.993 Hedges' g 
#>   expression
#>   <list>    
#> 1 <language>

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
# equal variance
two_sample_test(
  data = ToothGrowth,
  x = supp,
  y = len,
  var.equal = TRUE,
  type = "p"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 14
#>   term  group mean.group1 mean.group2 statistic df.error p.value
#>   <chr> <chr>       <dbl>       <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl>
#> 1 len   supp         20.7        17.0      1.92       58  0.0604
#>   method            estimate conf.level conf.low conf.high effectsize expression
#>   <chr>                <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>      <list>    
#> 1 Two Sample t-test    0.488       0.95  -0.0217     0.993 Hedges' g  <language>

# ----------------------- non-parametric -----------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
two_sample_test(
  data = ToothGrowth,
  x = supp,
  y = len,
  type = "np"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 11
#>   parameter1 parameter2 statistic p.value method                 estimate
#>   <chr>      <chr>          <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>                     <dbl>
#> 1 len        supp            6.36  0.0645 Wilcoxon rank sum test    0.279
#>   conf.level conf.low conf.high effectsize        expression
#>        <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>             <list>    
#> 1       0.95  -0.0124     0.561 r (rank biserial) <language>

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
two_sample_test(
  data = ToothGrowth,
  x = supp,
  y = len,
  type = "r"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 10
#>   statistic df.error p.value
#>       <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl>
#> 1      2.29     33.5  0.0286
#>   method                                               estimate conf.level
#>   <chr>                                                   <dbl>      <dbl>
#> 1 Yuen's test on trimmed means for independent samples    0.683       0.95
#>   conf.low conf.high effectsize                                             
#>      <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>                                                  
#> 1 -0.00736      2.36 Algina-Keselman-Penfield robust standardized difference
#>   expression
#>   <list>    
#> 1 <language>

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
two_sample_test(
  data = ToothGrowth,
  x = supp,
  y = len,
  type = "bayes"
)
#> # A tibble: 2 x 13
#>   term       estimate conf.level conf.low conf.high    pd rope.percentage
#>   <chr>         <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>
#> 1 Difference   -3.16        0.95  -6.66       0.528 0.960          0.0424
#> 2 Cohens_d      0.416       0.95  -0.0277     0.921 0.964          0.0494
#>   prior.distribution prior.location prior.scale  bf10 method          expression
#>   <chr>                       <dbl>       <dbl> <dbl> <chr>           <list>    
#> 1 cauchy                          0       0.707  1.20 Bayesian t-test <language>
#> 2 cauchy                          0       0.707  1.20 Bayesian t-test <language>

One-way ANOVAs

within-subjects design

# setup
library(statsExpressions)

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

if (require("afex", quietly = TRUE)) {
  # for reproducibility
  set.seed(123)
  oneway_anova(
    data = bugs_long,
    x = condition,
    y = desire,
    paired = TRUE,
    subject.id = subject,
    type = "p"
  )
}
#> # A tibble: 1 x 15
#>   term      sumsq sum.squares.error    df df.error meansq statistic  p.value
#>   <chr>     <dbl>             <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1 condition  233.              984.  2.63     229.   4.30      20.6 8.27e-11
#>   method                                              estimate conf.level
#>   <chr>                                                  <dbl>      <dbl>
#> 1 ANOVA estimation for factorial designs using 'afex'   0.0783       0.95
#>   conf.low conf.high effectsize       expression
#>      <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>            <list>    
#> 1   0.0217     0.140 Omega2 (partial) <language>

# ----------------------- non-parametric -----------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
oneway_anova(
  data = bugs_long,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  type = "np"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 12
#>   parameter1 parameter2 statistic df.error  p.value method                
#>   <chr>      <chr>          <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> <chr>                 
#> 1 desire     condition       55.8        3 4.56e-12 Friedman rank sum test
#>   estimate conf.level conf.low conf.high effectsize  expression
#>      <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>       <list>    
#> 1    0.175       0.95    0.118     0.248 Kendall's W <language>

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
oneway_anova(
  data = bugs_long,
  x = condition,
  y = desire,
  paired = TRUE,
  subject.id = subject,
  type = "r"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 11
#>   statistic    df df.error  p.value
#>       <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1      21.0  2.73     145. 1.15e-10
#>   method                                                              estimate
#>   <chr>                                                                  <dbl>
#> 1 A heteroscedastic one-way repeated measures ANOVA for trimmed means    0.664
#>   conf.low conf.high conf.level
#>      <dbl>     <dbl>      <dbl>
#> 1    0.466     0.971       0.95
#>   effectsize                                                      expression
#>   <chr>                                                           <list>    
#> 1 Algina-Keselman-Penfield robust standardized difference average <language>

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

if (utils::packageVersion("BayesFactor") >= package_version("0.9.12-4.3")) {
  # for reproducibility
  set.seed(123)
  oneway_anova(
    data = bugs_long,
    x = condition,
    y = desire,
    paired = TRUE,
    subject.id = subject,
    type = "bayes"
  )
}

between-subjects design

# setup
library(statsExpressions)

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
# unequal variance
oneway_anova(
  data = iris,
  x = Species,
  y = Sepal.Length,
  type = "p"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 11
#>   statistic    df df.error  p.value
#>       <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1      139.     2     92.2 1.51e-28
#>   method                                                   estimate conf.level
#>   <chr>                                                       <dbl>      <dbl>
#> 1 One-way analysis of means (not assuming equal variances)    0.743       0.95
#>   conf.low conf.high effectsize expression
#>      <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>      <list>    
#> 1    0.655     0.803 Omega2     <language>

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
# equal variance
oneway_anova(
  data = iris,
  x = Species,
  y = Sepal.Length,
  var.equal = TRUE,
  type = "p"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 11
#>   statistic    df df.error  p.value method                    estimate
#>       <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl> <chr>                        <dbl>
#> 1      119.     2      147 1.67e-31 One-way analysis of means    0.612
#>   conf.level conf.low conf.high effectsize expression
#>        <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>      <list>    
#> 1       0.95    0.517     0.683 Omega2     <language>

# ----------------------- non-parametric -----------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
oneway_anova(
  data = iris,
  x = Species,
  y = Sepal.Length,
  type = "np"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 12
#>   parameter1   parameter2 statistic df.error  p.value
#>   <chr>        <chr>          <dbl>    <int>    <dbl>
#> 1 Sepal.Length Species         96.9        2 8.92e-22
#>   method                       estimate conf.level conf.low conf.high
#>   <chr>                           <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1 Kruskal-Wallis rank sum test    0.651       0.95    0.588     0.722
#>   effectsize      expression
#>   <chr>           <list>    
#> 1 Epsilon2 (rank) <language>

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
oneway_anova(
  data = iris,
  x = Species,
  y = Sepal.Length,
  type = "r"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 11
#>   statistic    df df.error p.value estimate conf.level conf.low conf.high
#>       <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1      112.     2     53.8       0    0.846       0.95    0.759     0.933
#>   effectsize                        
#>   <chr>                             
#> 1 Explanatory measure of effect size
#>   method                                            expression
#>   <chr>                                             <list>    
#> 1 A heteroscedastic one-way ANOVA for trimmed means <language>

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
oneway_anova(
  data = iris,
  x = Species,
  y = Sepal.Length,
  type = "bayes"
)
#> # A tibble: 6 x 19
#>   term               estimate conf.level conf.low conf.high    pd
#>   <chr>                 <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1 mu                   5.84         0.95   5.76       5.93  1    
#> 2 Species-setosa      -0.829        0.95  -0.947     -0.713 1    
#> 3 Species-versicolor   0.0916       0.95  -0.0275     0.208 0.936
#> 4 Species-virginica    0.737        0.95   0.618      0.852 1    
#> 5 sig2                 0.267        0.95   0.210      0.335 1    
#> 6 g_Species            2.15         0.95   0.188     15.0   1    
#>   rope.percentage prior.distribution prior.location prior.scale component  
#>             <dbl> <chr>                       <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>      
#> 1           0     cauchy                          0       0.707 extra      
#> 2           0     cauchy                          0       0.707 conditional
#> 3           0.434 cauchy                          0       0.707 conditional
#> 4           0     cauchy                          0       0.707 conditional
#> 5           0     cauchy                          0       0.707 extra      
#> 6           0     cauchy                          0       0.707 extra      
#>      bf10 method                             r2 std.dev r2.conf.level
#>     <dbl> <chr>                           <dbl>   <dbl>         <dbl>
#> 1 1.87e28 Bayes factors for linear models 0.612  0.0311          0.95
#> 2 1.87e28 Bayes factors for linear models 0.612  0.0311          0.95
#> 3 1.87e28 Bayes factors for linear models 0.612  0.0311          0.95
#> 4 1.87e28 Bayes factors for linear models 0.612  0.0311          0.95
#> 5 1.87e28 Bayes factors for linear models 0.612  0.0311          0.95
#> 6 1.87e28 Bayes factors for linear models 0.612  0.0311          0.95
#>   r2.conf.low r2.conf.high expression
#>         <dbl>        <dbl> <list>    
#> 1       0.544        0.667 <language>
#> 2       0.544        0.667 <language>
#> 3       0.544        0.667 <language>
#> 4       0.544        0.667 <language>
#> 5       0.544        0.667 <language>
#> 6       0.544        0.667 <language>

Contingency table analyses

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
library(statsExpressions)

# create data structure
paired_data <-
  structure(
    list(
      response_before =
        structure(
          c(1L, 2L, 1L, 2L),
          .Label = c("no", "yes"),
          class = "factor"
        ),
      response_after = structure(
        c(1L, 1L, 2L, 2L),
        .Label = c("no", "yes"),
        class = "factor"
      ),
      Freq = c(65L, 25L, 5L, 5L)
    ),
    class = "data.frame",
    row.names = c(NA, -4L)
  )

# ------------------------ non-Bayesian -----------------------------

# association tests

# unpaired
set.seed(123)
contingency_table(
  data = mtcars,
  x = am,
  y = cyl,
  paired = FALSE,
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 10
#>   statistic    df p.value method                     estimate conf.level
#>       <dbl> <int>   <dbl> <chr>                         <dbl>      <dbl>
#> 1      8.74     2  0.0126 Pearson's Chi-squared test    0.464       0.95
#>   conf.low conf.high effectsize        expression
#>      <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>             <list>    
#> 1        0     0.777 Cramer's V (adj.) <language>

# paired
set.seed(123)
contingency_table(
  data = paired_data,
  x = response_before,
  y = response_after,
  paired = TRUE,
  counts = "Freq"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 10
#>   statistic    df  p.value method                     estimate conf.level
#>       <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl> <chr>                         <dbl>      <dbl>
#> 1      13.3     1 0.000261 McNemar's Chi-squared test    0.333       0.95
#>   conf.low conf.high effectsize expression
#>      <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>      <list>    
#> 1    0.164     0.427 Cohen's g  <language>

# goodness-of-fit tests

# with counts
set.seed(123)
contingency_table(
  data = as.data.frame(HairEyeColor),
  x = Eye,
  counts = Freq,
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 10
#>   statistic    df  p.value method                                   estimate
#>       <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl> <chr>                                       <dbl>
#> 1      133.     3 9.65e-29 Chi-squared test for given probabilities    0.272
#>   conf.level conf.low conf.high effectsize        expression
#>        <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>             <list>    
#> 1       0.95    0.222     0.316 Cramer's V (adj.) <language>

# ------------------------ Bayesian -----------------------------

# association test
contingency_table(
  data = mtcars,
  x = am,
  y = cyl,
  paired = FALSE,
  type = "bayes"
)
#> # A tibble: 8 x 13
#>   term      estimate conf.level conf.low conf.high    pd rope.percentage
#>   <chr>        <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>           <dbl>
#> 1 cell[1,1]    3.15        0.95    0.692     6.55      1               0
#> 2 cell[2,1]    7.47        0.95    3.34     11.7       1               0
#> 3 cell[1,2]    3.96        0.95    1.20      7.70      1               0
#> 4 cell[2,2]    3.18        0.95    0.778     6.51      1               0
#> 5 cell[1,3]   10.8         0.95    6.56     15.9       1               0
#> 6 cell[2,3]    2.27        0.95    0.332     5.31      1               0
#> 7 Ratio       NA          NA      NA        NA        NA              NA
#> 8 Cramers_v    0.478       0.95    0.221     0.725     1               0
#>   prior.distribution      prior.location prior.scale  bf10
#>   <chr>                            <dbl>       <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1 independent multinomial              0           1  16.8
#> 2 independent multinomial              0           1  16.8
#> 3 independent multinomial              0           1  16.8
#> 4 independent multinomial              0           1  16.8
#> 5 independent multinomial              0           1  16.8
#> 6 independent multinomial              0           1  16.8
#> 7 independent multinomial              0           1  16.8
#> 8 independent multinomial              0           1  16.8
#>   method                              expression
#>   <chr>                               <list>    
#> 1 Bayesian contingency table analysis <language>
#> 2 Bayesian contingency table analysis <language>
#> 3 Bayesian contingency table analysis <language>
#> 4 Bayesian contingency table analysis <language>
#> 5 Bayesian contingency table analysis <language>
#> 6 Bayesian contingency table analysis <language>
#> 7 Bayesian contingency table analysis <language>
#> 8 Bayesian contingency table analysis <language>

# goodness-of-fit test
contingency_table(
  data = as.data.frame(HairEyeColor),
  x = Eye,
  counts = Freq,
  ratio = c(0.2, 0.2, 0.3, 0.3),
  type = "bayes"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 3
#>      bf10 prior.scale expression
#>     <dbl>       <dbl> <list>    
#> 1 3.74e55           1 <language>

Correlation analyses

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
library(statsExpressions)

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
corr_test(
  data = mtcars,
  x = wt,
  y = mpg,
  type = "parametric"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 13
#>   parameter1 parameter2 estimate conf.level conf.low conf.high statistic
#>   <chr>      <chr>         <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1 wt         mpg          -0.868       0.95   -0.934    -0.744     -9.56
#>   df.error  p.value method              n.obs effectsize          expression
#>      <int>    <dbl> <chr>               <int> <chr>               <list>    
#> 1       30 1.29e-10 Pearson correlation    32 Pearson correlation <language>

# ----------------------- non-parametric -----------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
corr_test(
  data = mtcars,
  x = wt,
  y = mpg,
  type = "nonparametric"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 12
#>   parameter1 parameter2 estimate conf.level conf.low conf.high statistic
#>   <chr>      <chr>         <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1 wt         mpg          -0.886       0.95   -0.945    -0.774      9.24
#>    p.value method               n.obs effectsize           expression
#>      <dbl> <chr>                <int> <chr>                <list>    
#> 1 1.49e-11 Spearman correlation    32 Spearman correlation <language>

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
corr_test(
  data = mtcars,
  x = wt,
  y = mpg,
  type = "robust"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 13
#>   parameter1 parameter2 estimate conf.level conf.low conf.high statistic
#>   <chr>      <chr>         <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1 wt         mpg          -0.864       0.95   -0.932    -0.738     -9.41
#>   df.error  p.value method                         n.obs
#>      <int>    <dbl> <chr>                          <int>
#> 1       30 1.84e-10 Winsorized Pearson correlation    32
#>   effectsize                     expression
#>   <chr>                          <list>    
#> 1 Winsorized Pearson correlation <language>

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
corr_test(
  data = mtcars,
  x = wt,
  y = mpg,
  type = "bayes"
)
#> # A tibble: 1 x 16
#>   parameter1 parameter2 estimate conf.level conf.low conf.high    pd
#>   <chr>      <chr>         <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1 wt         mpg          -0.843       0.95   -0.919    -0.759     1
#>   rope.percentage      bf10 prior.distribution prior.location prior.scale
#>             <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>                       <dbl>       <dbl>
#> 1               0 56223033. beta                         1.41        1.41
#>   method                       n.obs effectsize                   expression
#>   <chr>                        <int> <chr>                        <list>    
#> 1 Bayesian Pearson correlation    32 Bayesian Pearson correlation <language>

Meta-analysis

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
library(statsExpressions)
library(metaplus)

# renaming to what `statsExpressions` expects
df <- dplyr::rename(mag, estimate = yi, std.error = sei)

# ----------------------- parametric ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
meta_analysis(data = df, type = "parametric")
#> # A tibble: 1 x 12
#>   term    estimate std.error conf.level conf.low conf.high statistic  p.value
#>   <chr>      <dbl>     <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1 Overall   -0.767     0.212       0.95    -1.18    -0.351     -3.62 0.000295
#>   weight method                        effectsize                     expression
#>    <dbl> <chr>                         <chr>                          <list>    
#> 1     NA Meta-analysis using 'metafor' meta-analytic summary estimate <language>

# ----------------------- robust --------------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
meta_analysis(data = df, type = "robust")
#> # A tibble: 1 x 12
#>   term    estimate std.error conf.low conf.high statistic  p.value weight
#>   <chr>      <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl>
#> 1 Overall   -0.746     0.234    -1.26    -0.343     -3.19 0.000777     NA
#>   conf.level method                               
#>        <dbl> <chr>                                
#> 1       0.95 Robust meta-analysis using 'metaplus'
#>   effectsize                     expression
#>   <chr>                          <list>    
#> 1 meta-analytic summary estimate <language>

# ----------------------- Bayes Factor ---------------------------------------

# for reproducibility
set.seed(123)
meta_analysis(data = df, type = "bayes")
#> # A tibble: 2 x 17
#>   term    estimate std.error conf.level conf.low conf.high weight  bf10  rhat
#>   <chr>      <dbl>     <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1 Overall   -0.654     0.221       0.95   -1.08     -0.230     NA  53.0  1.00
#> 2 tau        0.488     0.182       0.95    0.171     0.842     NA  53.0  1.00
#>     ess component prior.distribution prior.location prior.scale
#>   <dbl> <chr>     <chr>                       <dbl>       <dbl>
#> 1 4424. meta      Student's t                     0       0.707
#> 2 3926. meta      Inverse gamma                   1       0.15 
#>   method                                 effectsize                      
#>   <chr>                                  <chr>                           
#> 1 Bayesian meta-analysis using 'metaBMA' meta-analytic posterior estimate
#> 2 Bayesian meta-analysis using 'metaBMA' meta-analytic posterior estimate
#>   expression
#>   <list>    
#> 1 <language>
#> 2 <language>
